Amy Fishman was born in 1953. She will be 70 years old after celebrating her birthday in 2023. She was adopted by actor, Henry Fonda and his third wife Susan Blanchard (nÃ©e Jacobson), a socialite and former lyricist and theatrical producer. Her adoptive parents were married from December 27, 1950, until their divorce in May 1956. Her mother Susan described her role in her marriage to her father Henry as âa geishaâ.

According to Susan, she was doing everything she could to please him, dealing with and solving problems he would not acknowledge. Nothing is known about Amy Fishmanâs biological parents and family. She has siblings from other relationships of both her adoptive parents. She is the sister of Peter Fonda, Jane Fonda, Zachery Taylor, Marilyn Taylor, Janice Taylor, John Taylor, and George Taylor.

Amy Fishmanâs maternal grandparents are Australian-born American interior designer and decorator Dorothy Marian Kiaora Blanchard or Dorothy Hammerstein (7 June 1899 â 3 August 1987) and Henry Jacobson, a New York businessman. Her paternal grandparents are printer William Brace Fonda, and Herberta (Jaynes). Nothing is known about her educational background and qualifications.

Amy Fishmanâs father Henry Fonda died from heart disease, on August 12, 1982, at age 77, in Los Angeles, California, U.S. According to the New York Times, Henry Fonda left his estate to Amy Fishman and his widow, Shirlee Mae Adams. His children Jane and Peter Fonda received nothing. He mentioned in his will that, âMy decision is not in any sense a measure of my deep affection for them.â

Henry Fonda said he was providing for his wife and adopted daughter Amy âbecause they are dependent on me for their support.â Peter Fonda also died on August 16, 2019, at age 79, from respiratory failure caused by lung cancer.
